snippet: On the second day of the government shutdown, President Obama urged passage of a stopgap spending measure and a debt-ceiling increase, but there were no signs of progress after a meeting.
abstract: Pres Obama tells Republican leaders, in their first meeting since the budget impasse shuttered many federal operations, that he will negotiate with them only after they agree to the funding needed to reopen the government and also to an essential increase in the nation's debt limit, without add-ons.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: On the second day of the government shutdown, President Obama urged passage of a stopgap spending measure and a debt-ceiling increase, but there were no signs of progress after a meeting.

headline.main: Obama Sets Conditions for Talks: Pass Funding and Raise Debt Ceiling
headline.print_headline: Obama Sets Conditions For Talks: Pass Funding And Raise Debt Ceiling
